record.description: Drawing of an image from a seal of 1400 B.C.E. displaying early agriculture techniques of seeding and plowing employed by Sumerians. The farming methods are similar to those described in a 3,700-year old farm bulletin written in Sumerian on a clay tablet, which a joint expedition of University of Chicago and University of Pennsylvania archeologists to the city of Nippur in Iraq discovered in the 1950s.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
